alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 4:55AM EDT until March 28 at 10:07AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alabama... Chattahoochee River at 14th Street at Columbus affecting Chattahoochee, Russell, Muscogee and Lee Counties. Yellowjacket Creek at Hammett Rd below Hogansville affecting Troup County. Tobesofkee Creek near Macon affecting Bibb County. Towaliga River at GA 83 near Juliette affecting Monroe County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Georgia... New River at GA 100 near Corinth affecting Heard County. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Roswell, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Columbus, Union, Omaha...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 13.7 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.4 feet late this morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
